summary: Whipped up this sketch of Venom's new monster form in the current Donny Cates/Ryan Stegman run of Venom. I love how freaky this...
caption: Whipped up this sketch of Venom’s new monster form in the current Donny Cates/Ryan Stegman run of Venom. I love how freaky this design is and do we have an official name for this form? God Venom? Spiral Venom? Either way expect a colored soon.

summary: TIL that Marvel reconstructed Robert Downey, Jr. with a body double and CGI for many of Iron Man 3’s key scenes because he...
body: TIL that Marvel reconstructed Robert Downey, Jr. with a body double and CGI for many of Iron Man 3’s key scenes because he sustained an ankle injury on set and they didn’t want to push back the release date. The best part? You can’t even tell.

reblog.comment: TIL that Marvel reconstructed Robert Downey, Jr. with a body double and CGI for many of Iron Man 3’s key scenes because he sustained an ankle injury on set and they didn’t want to push back the release date. The best part? You can’t even tell.

trail.content_raw: TIL that Marvel reconstructed Robert Downey, Jr. with a body double and CGI for many of Iron Man 3’s key scenes because he sustained an ankle injury on set and they didn’t want to push back the release date. The best part? You can’t even tell.
trail.content: TIL that Marvel reconstructed Robert Downey, Jr. with a body double and CGI for many of Iron Man 3’s key scenes because he sustained an ankle injury on set and they didn’t want to push back the release date. The best part? You can’t even tell.

body:
Shower Thoughts

How come in the comics and cartoons Batman has white over his eyes like Spiderman but in the live action movies his eyes are showing but Spiderman’s aren’t ???

This is such a huge pet peeve. Like I knew Batman looked fucking weird in the live action movies. But I didn’t know why til now.

blog.name: amandareviewsstuff
blog.title: Amanda Reviews Stuff
blog.description: Spoilers ahead - I can't be tamed.

title: Doctor Strange (2016)
body:
I’m still extremely behind in Marvel movies - two films have come out since I finally got around to watching “Captain America: Civil War” (2016). But I’m still plugging along, calling myself a fan while never actually making it to the movie theater to see the films. I’ll catch up eventually. My tally is now nine Marvel films left to watch. “Doctor Strange” is the first film starring the superhero of the same name (played by Benedict Cumberbatch with an American accent). It’s our introduction to the character and does not feature any of the familiar Marvel faces, though vaguely mentions the Avengers in passing - a preparation for “Avengers: Infinity War Part One” (2018), which I haven’t seen yet. Strange was an arrogant surgeon before a car accident leaves him with severe nerve damage in his hands. Feeling that without his work, he’s lost his purpose, he seeks healing from a mysterious temple in Thailand. There, he learns to expand his reality and discovers mysterious spiritual power, which allows him to become a protector of the planet from dark entities.

The film follows a very typical origin story plot: our hero overcomes his own doubts and insecurities to harness newly found power to save the world. It was predictable in that sense, but what sets this story apart is the complexity and strangeness of the abilities he gains. Strange finds the ability to hop into other dimensions, escape his physical body, alter space with energy, and with the help of ancient artifact (later revealed to be an Infinity Stone), manipulate time. The complicated theories behind these abilities are (appreciatively) watered down for the general audience to follow, so while I don’t 100% buy that it’s realistic, I like to see the way the altered worlds are filmed, with entire buildings folding into each other and spiritual selves battling while physical bodies lie still, near death. It’s cool to see this portrayed on screen, even if the story isn’t perfect.

My least favorite part of the movie was the forced romance between Strange and the ER doctor Christine Palmer (Rachel McAdams). Not only does the movie not pass the Bechdel test, but Palmer has an attachment and care for Strange that seems completely unwarranted. They were “barely lovers” as Strange shouts at her, but Palmer still continually takes care of him. He offers nothing for her. Why does she like him? He’s arrogant and doesn’t care about her at all, until he disappears to Thailand an re-emerges as a spiritual superhero, where we assume he’s realized his feelings for her all along and goes back to her, where he knows she’ll be waiting for him. Tragic, really. But not all of the characters in this movie were so poorly realized. I liked the setup of conflict between Strange, who is unafraid of breaking the rules to achieve a greater end, and Mordo (Chiwetel Ejiofor), the man who leads him to the temple and abides by a strict moral code. The fact that the conflict is amended with Strange’s reckless tactics upsets Mordo to the point that he leaves the organization, looking like he’ll be a potential nemesis for Strange in the future.

I’ll end this post by discussing the casting of Cumberbatch for this role. Strange is an unlikable character, in a similar vein to Tony Stark (another Marvel hero played by Robert Downey Jr.). But Stark’s brass arrogance can actually be charming, Strange’s take on humor falls flat. Cumberbatch, with his less bold British sense of humor, just doesn’t pull off the likable asshole character in the brazen way the role requires. He’s obviously a sublime actor, but maybe not the best casting choice for this specific role. Stark’s tragic backstory perhaps redeems him, but Strange’s only redemption comes from his former profession where he saved lives with his brilliance. And even then, he only treated people where he could attain some glory for himself in the process. I guess he just never has his “save the cat” moment to have me rooting for him, so his forced attempts of humor stemming from pop culture just don’t work.

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Hydra's Secret Weapon
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2mjZYop

by Pearl09

The Avengers are on a mission to stop Hydra from recovering a dangerous weapon that had been stolen. They know that when they find the weapon, they need to either destroy it, or keep it in the tower. No one was expecting the weapon to be this…

Words: 1923, Chapters: 1/21, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: Gen, M/M
  • Characters: Steve Rogers, James “Bucky” Barnes, Tony Stark, Pepper Potts, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Bruce Banner, Thor (Marvel), Loki (Marvel), Clint Barton, Peter Parker, Sam Wilson (Marvel)
  • Relationships: James “Bucky” Barnes/Steve Rogers, Pepper Potts/Tony Stark, Peter Parker & Original Female Character
  • Additional Tags: Established Relationship, Not Canon Compliant, Other Additional Tags to Be Added, stucky fluff, Dad Steve, dad bucky, Original Character-centric, We Need More Character Stuffed Animals, So I’m Making Some, Original Character(s), Avengers Family, Avengers Tower, Protective Avengers, Loki Is A Good Person Now, Baby Peter Parker, And By Baby I Mean Elementary School

read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2mjZYop

read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2mjZYop

by Pearl09

The Avengers are on a mission to stop Hydra from recovering a dangerous weapon that had been stolen. They know that when they find the weapon, they need to either destroy it, or keep it in the tower. No one was expecting the weapon to be this…

blog.title: ✨🌙The mind can be a vast and wondrous place to be at🌙✨
blog.description:
🔷 Ash || She/Her || Artist || Fanfic Writer || Multishipper || This blog supports crossovers and multi-crossovers || This blog also supports crossover ships || 🔷
Hello everyone, and welcome to my multifandom blog! I'm just a person who loves drawing, animals, music, movies, collecting plushies and figurines, and video games. For the most part, I post my art, edits, gifs, and other things that are within my interests. Feel free to send me asks, message me, or drop a quick "hi" if you want to.

title: Headcanon Trio of the Day
body:
Marvel: If someone asked for Loki's opinion on the food and drinks from Midgard and what they’re like, his two short answers would be “I like the food” and “the alcohol tastes terrible”.

Devil May Cry: Nero wants to buy another pair of headphones one day seeing as he lost his last ones. Listening to music while slaying demons left and right on his missions always got him excited, and now, he misses that feeling more than ever.

Voltron Legendary Defender: There were a couple of earthling games that Lotor learned how to play during his time in the Castle of Lions. The three that he liked the most were Chess, Checkers, and Truth or Dare.
